docs.lead_paragraph: Patient costs have risen as doctors have become more entrepreneurial, protecting their turf through lobbying by medical societies and increasing revenues by offering new and more lucrative procedures.

headline.main: Patients’ Costs Skyrocket; Specialists’ Incomes Soar
headline.print_headline: Patients’ Costs Skyrocket; Specialists’ Incomes Soar

docs.abstract: Patient costs are rising as doctors become more entrepreneurial, protecting their turf through lobbying by medical societies and increasing revenues by offering new and more lucrative procedures; specialists who perform medical procedures command the highest incomes among doctors (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
docs.snippet: Patient costs have risen as doctors have become more entrepreneurial, protecting their turf through lobbying by medical societies and increasing revenues by offering new and more lucrative procedures.

docs.lead_paragraph: A clerical worker is back on her feet, thanks in part to The Neediest Cases Fund.
docs.abstract: Editorial highlights case of Gladys Puglla, whose unmanageable medical bill following a stroke was drastically lowered after negotiations between the hospital and the Community Service Society, beneficiary of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
docs.snippet: A clerical worker is back on her feet, thanks in part to The Neediest Cases Fund.

docs.lead_paragraph: Young adults are surging into the state and federal exchanges now that website glitches have been fixed.

headline.main: A Good Start for Health Care Sign-Ups
headline.print_headline: A Good Start for Health Care Sign-Ups

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes report finding that enrollment has increased broadly across health insurance exchanges, and that uptick has been especially pronounced among young adults who are key to sustainability of the Affordable Care Act; disputes critics who say level of young participants is still far lower than necessary.
docs.snippet: Young adults are surging into the state and federal exchanges now that website glitches have been fixed.

docs.lead_paragraph: A backlog of applications for coverage under the Affordable Care Act has resulted in delays for many people awaiting insurance cards or authorization for treatment.

headline.main: Navigating a New Health Plan, After the Surge
headline.print_headline: Navigating a New Health Plan, After the Surge

docs.abstract: Your Money Adviser column on difficulties navigating health insurance exchanges; says backlog of applications for coverage under Affordable Care Act has resulted in delays for many people awaiting insurance cards or authorization for treatment.
docs.snippet: A backlog of applications for coverage under the Affordable Care Act has resulted in delays for many people awaiting insurance cards or authorization for treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday struck down a 2011 North Carolina law requiring abortion providers to perform an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before having an abortion, arguing it violated the constitutional right to free speech of doctors.

headline.main: North Carolina Ultrasound Abortion Law Ruled Illegal by Judge
headline.print_headline: North Carolina Ultrasound Abortion Law Ruled Illegal by Judge

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Friday struck down a 2011 North Carolina law requiring abortion providers to perform an ultrasound and explain it to a woman before having an abortion, arguing it violated the constitutional right to free speech of doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Houston's openly gay mayor, Annise Parker, has wedded her longtime partner at a private home in California, even as her home state of Texas bans such same-sex marriages.

headline.print_headline: Houston's Openly Gay Mayor Marries Longtime Partner in California

headline.main: The Real Health Care 'War' on the Young

docs.abstract: Those who criticize Obamacare as discriminatory against young men have turned a blind eye to how health insurance premiums are traditionally established, an economist writes.
